channel.title: Chat Tags?
channel.description:
Never seen this done before on a 317, but this is not for yell , it is for your general chat and right click.
How would i go about adding this, When you right click someone their name is [War-Chief]Dell, and [War-Chief] can be a <shad> color .. also, when i talk on chat it will come up as [Admincrownhere] [War-Chief]Dell: Hey guys
ive seen it on legacy wanting to know if it can be implemented on a 317 :]

item.title: Chat Tags?
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:6, topic:405773”]Well for an ingame tag, you would have to add it client-sided, because the code i showed you handles the chat. and this is for yell, so it would not be the same.

if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Dell")) { ("<shad=15369497>[#1Hybrid]"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");[/quote]
I see what your saying but this can be done server-sided too, i can add images into chat name aswell just by using ,<img=2>

Read full topic

item.title: Chat Tags?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well for an ingame tag, you would have to add it client-sided, because the code i showed you handles the chat. and this is for yell, so it would not be the same.

if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Dell")) { ("<shad=15369497>[#1Hybrid]"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");

Read full topic

item.title: Chat Tags?

Thanks for the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat Tags?
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:2, topic:405773”]Well, look at the yell tag and learn it then try to convert it for chat. It would be in client.java client-sided.
This piece of code handles the general chat stuff.

//My players icons showing up when I speak if(myPrivilege == 4) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr0@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 3) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 2) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 1) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr1@" + myPlayer.name); } else { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, myPlayer.name); }

I like your idea, if your having any trouble with it pm me.[/quote]

Well i was thinking of making server-sided something like this . .

if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Dell")) { ("<shad=15369497>[#1Hybrid]"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
I just want that tag to appear ingame and not in yell, because i have yell tags which is different, i plan on hosting like pk tournaments and whoever wins gets a custom ingame tag.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat Tags?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well, look at the yell tag and learn it then try to convert it for chat. It would be in client.java client-sided.
This piece of code handles the general chat stuff.

//My players icons showing up when I speak if(myPrivilege == 4) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr0@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 3) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 2) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name); } else if(myPrivilege == 1) { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr1@" + myPlayer.name); } else { pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, myPlayer.name); }

I like your idea, if your having any trouble with it pm me.

Read full topic
